body: so I got to silver 5 and a few days ago and ive been trying to get to silver 4 but i quickly found out that I lost almost every single game (also im not some1 who started in b1 and just got to s5 in a few wins I went from b5 to s5 in about half a year) in every game I always get shit teamates who r not only super toxic (genrally the bad jungler who never ganks) and always focus kills not objectives like a shyvana I had and had a good score but never went for towers even if she had like full hp and I lost that match. but in bronze, i had teammates who were actually good at the game better than the silver players I play with can someone back me up and agree with me.

replies.body: Any rank 5 (Silver 5, Gold 5 etc.) are full of dumbasses who just flame others, because they are generally worse then their rank, and are just stuck there because demotions don't happen from those ranks.

There is a reason that people who are higher ranked are consistently able to climb faster than those in a lower elo. 

In saying this, you are playing in low silver, and are likely getting a mix of players from bronze-high silver. A lot of players at this level are very inconsistent.  You will find some players go absolutely godlike in some games and can pass for smurfs, and then the next game they are 3/9. A lot of people focus on pure mechanics and don't really know where they should be on the map at different parts of the game and this is what sets them apart from people higher up. 

Junglers that don't gank sure are annoying, but you should be confident enough in your own gameplay to be able to play your lane without the need for ganks and without the need for buffs. They are helpful, but don't expect them and start whining when they don't come. If the enemy jungler is ganking, you just need to learn to adjust your playstyle to accommodate this. 

Personally I think you are where you need to be right now. Your CS is all over the place and averaging 9+ deaths on literally all but two of your champs you have played  is pretty bad, especially since you are ADC. That would be weighing down your team significantly and provides the enemy team a chance to snowball (something bronze and silver players generally don't deal well with and just end up tilting and flaming).

The reason you're thinking your Bronze teammates were better than your Silver teammates could be that Silver is the default "Placement" rank. There is a high chance to get a player who has only just levelled to 30 and has no proper experience in the game, whereas those you played with in Bronze probably have a solid 100 or so games in Ranked. 

To an overall argument of ranks determining a player's skill: generally, yes, but it's that simple. There are Bronze players with amazing mechanics that rival that of Diamond, but then have no idea what they're doing. I had a Riven OTP in my team in Bronze V. Their mechanics were so clean that I was amazed that they were in Bronze. Come late game, however, they were just running around dying and having no idea what to do. 

The Rank you get is basically an average of your skills. You can have great mechanics, but if you have no game knowledge whatsoever you'll be Bronze V.  Or you may have great game knowledge, but then not have the mechanics to implement them.

To be honest, if you're in bronze/silver/gold you get mixed up with bronzies silvers and goldies in this server, as this server is quite small. So it isn't the rank you've gotten to, it's probably luck.
